exception.name: ErrorOpenTransactionFound
exception.description: This exception is thrown if the SE API functions disableSecureElement or updateDevice are called when there are open (unfinished) transactions on the device. The functions require that all transactions be in a completed state before they can execute. If one or more transactions are still in the open state when these operations are attempted, ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised to prevent the operation from proceeding while transactions remain unfinished.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorOpenTransactionFound that is thrown if there are open transactions when they must be closed.
javadoc.description: This exception is thrown when disableSecureElement or updateDevice functions cannot proceed because there are open (unfinished) transactions on the device. These operations have a prerequisite that all transactions must be in a completed state before they can execute. Open transactions represent active processing contexts that must be properly finalized before certain device-level operations can be safely performed. ErrorOpenTransactionFound indicates that the attempted operation was blocked because at least one transaction is still in the open state. Recovery requires completing (finishing) all open transactions via the finishTransaction function before retrying the blocked operation. This prevents device operations from occurring while transaction processing is incomplete, protecting data consistency and transaction integrity.

specification.section: 3.2.1 Device State Management - disableSecureElement and 3.2.2 Device Update Operations - updateDevice
specification.requirement: The functions disableSecureElement and updateDevice require that all transactions be in a completed (finished) state before they can execute. These operations cannot proceed while open (unfinished) transactions exist on the device. If the device has any open transactions at the time these functions are called, they SHALL raise the exception ErrorOpenTransactionFound and reject the operation. The caller must complete all open transactions via finishTransaction before retrying these device-level operations.
specification.applicability: Device-level operations - disableSecureElement and updateDevice functions only, when open transactions exist

condition.scenario: Application calls disableSecureElement with unfinished transactions
condition.description: The application attempts to disable the Secure Element while transactions are still open
condition.trigger: The application calls startTransaction one or more times, creating open transactions, but never calls finishTransaction to complete them. Then the application calls disableSecureElement to shut down the device. The function detects the open transactions and raises ErrorOpenTransactionFound instead of proceeding with disablement.

condition.scenario: Application calls updateDevice with incomplete transactions
condition.description: The application attempts to update the device while transactions are still in progress
condition.trigger: The application has created open transactions that are still being processed. The application calls updateDevice to perform a device firmware or configuration update. The function checks transaction state, finds open transactions, and raises ErrorOpenTransactionFound. Device update cannot proceed until transactions are completed.

condition.description: A batch processing operation creates transactions but the final cleanup fails to close them
condition.trigger: A batch operation creates multiple transactions and closes most of them but one remains open due to an error. When the application attempts to call disableSecureElement to finalize the batch process, the unclosed transaction is detected and ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised.

condition.scenario: Exception in transaction processing leaves transaction open
condition.description: An exception or error during transaction processing leaves a transaction in the open state
condition.trigger: An exception occurs during transaction processing, causing the normal transaction completion flow to be interrupted. The transaction remains open but the application continues and calls updateDevice. The open transaction is detected and ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised.

condition.scenario: Client crash or disconnection leaves orphaned transactions
condition.description: The client application crashes or disconnects while transactions are open
condition.trigger: A client application crashes while transactions are open, leaving them in an orphaned state on the device. When the client reconnects or when another operation attempts to call disableSecureElement or updateDevice, the orphaned open transactions are detected and ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised.

executionSequence.step: User/application calls disableSecureElement or updateDevice function
Function validates input parameters and checks authorization
Function checks device state and operational prerequisites
Function queries the number of currently open transactions on the device
If NO open transactions exist → proceed to step 6
If open transactions exist → ErrorOpenTransactionFound raised, function exits
Function performs pre-operation validation and preparation
Function initiates communication with Secure Element
Function transmits the operation command (disable or update) to Secure Element
Function receives acknowledgment from Secure Element
Function completes post-operation cleanup and state updates
Function closes communication channel with Secure Element
Function returns successfully with operation completed

recovery.step: Finish all open transactions using finishTransaction
Retry the operation after all transactions complete

postconditionality.state: The requested operation (disable or update) is not performed. Device state remains unchanged by the failed operation attempt.
The device remains in its current operational state. The failed prerequisite check does not affect normal device operations.
The open transactions remain in their current state. The failed operation attempt does not affect transaction state.
All device functionality except the blocked operation remains available and operational.
The caller must take recovery action (close open transactions) before retrying the blocked operation.
The exception does not trigger cascading failures or secondary exceptions.

notes.note: Indication: An open transaction exists when it should not - transaction still active
Topics: Transaction Management, Transaction State, Transaction Validation, State Constraints

scenario.name: Scenario 1: Device Shutdown with Transaction Cleanup
scenario.description: An application calls disableSecureElement to shut down a Secure Element device. When ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised, it indicates there are unfinished transactions. The application retrieves the open transaction IDs, calls finishTransaction on each, and then retries disableSecureElement to complete the shutdown.
scenario.errorContext: Open transactions prevent device disablement - must close first

scenario.name: Scenario 2: Firmware Update with Transaction State Validation
scenario.description: An enterprise system performs a scheduled firmware update on Secure Elements by calling updateDevice. When ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised on a device, it indicates active transactions are preventing the update. The system pauses the update, waits for or closes existing transactions, and then retries the update.
scenario.errorContext: Open transactions block device update - require transaction completion first

scenario.name: Scenario 3: Batch Processing with Transaction Lifecycle Management
scenario.description: A batch processing application creates multiple transactions, processes them, and should close them before finalizing. When ErrorOpenTransactionFound is raised during finalization, it indicates incomplete transaction cleanup. The application implements robust transaction tracking to ensure all transactions are properly closed before batch completion.
scenario.errorContext: Incomplete transaction cleanup prevents batch finalization

scenario.name: Scenario 4: Exception Handling with Transaction Cleanup in Error Paths
scenario.description: An application must handle exceptions gracefully and ensure transactions are always closed. When an exception occurs during transaction processing, the exception handler ensures finishTransaction is called. This prevents open transactions from blocking subsequent device-level operations like disable or update.
scenario.errorContext: Exception during transaction processing requires cleanup to prevent blocking device operations
